Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring a training program for first responders and an awareness campaign regarding domestic violence-related traumatic brain injuries
Items.MatterName: Requiring a training program for first responders and an awareness campaign regarding domestic violence-related traumatic brain injuries

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to signage regarding transgender rights and services at hospitals
Items.MatterName: Signage regarding transgender rights and services at hospitals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to report on training for medical care for transgender and gender non-conforming persons
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to report on training for medical care for transgender and gender non-conforming persons.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring schools and child care programs to stock epinephrine auto-injector devices
Items.MatterName: Requiring schools and child care programs to stock epinephrine auto-injector devices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating an automated text messaging system to provide participants with important reminders regarding children’s health and development
Items.MatterName: Creating an automated text messaging system to provide participants with important reminders regarding children’s health and development.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to training for medical personnel in public schools and reporting on participation in such training
Items.MatterName: Training for medical personnel in public schools and reporting on participation in such training.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expanding the availability of the newborn home visiting program
Items.MatterName: Expanding the availability of the newborn home visiting program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.7166/A.645, which would allow the presence of epinephrine auto-injector devices on pre-school premises.
Items.MatterName: Allow the presence of epinephrine auto-injector devices on pre-school premises (S.7166/A.645).

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would establish the medical debt relief fund and allow taxpayers to make a donation to such fund on their personal tax returns.
Items.MatterName: Establish the medical debt relief fund and allow taxpayers to make a donation to such fund on their personal tax returns.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Food and Drug Administration to require warning labels on sugar sweetened beverages
Items.MatterName: Require warning labels on sugar sweetened beverages.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.1239A/A.1556A, to prohibit certain food additives, to prohibit the sale of food containing certain color additives at schools, and to prohibit the use of substances “Generally Recognized as Safe” in food unless certain reporting requirements are met.
Items.MatterName: Prohibit certain food additives, to prohibit the sale of food containing certain color additives at schools, and to prohibit the use of substances “Generally Recognized as Safe” in food (S.1239A/A.1556A).

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the U.S. Food and Drug Administration to require chain restaurants to include added sugars information in the nutrition information available to consumers on request.
Items.MatterName: U.S. Food and Drug Administration to require chain restaurants to include added sugars information in the nutrition information available to consumers on request.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an education campaign for healthcare providers and the public on opioid use disorder and the use of opioid agonist therapies during and after pregnancy, and the distribution of opioid antagonists at neighborhood health service centers
Items.MatterName: Education campaign for healthcare providers and the public on opioid use disorder and the use of opioid agonist therapies during and after pregnancy, and the distribution of opioid antagonists at neighborhood health service centers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a child care opioid antagonist program
Items.MatterName: Establishing a child care opioid antagonist program

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an outreach campaign to inform parents about their rights in relation to child care programs
Items.MatterName: Outreach campaign to inform parents about their rights in relation to child care programs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on training for child care inspectors
Items.MatterName: Reporting on training for child care inspectors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to create and implement a public awareness strategy to offer overdose prevention and reversal training to public health sanitarians of the department and to teaching staff of child care programs
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to create and implement a public awareness strategy to offer overdose prevention and reversal training to public health sanitarians of the department and to teaching staff of child care programs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to public access to water bottle-filling stations in city buildings
Items.MatterName: Public access to water bottle-filling stations in city buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.6225/A.3899A, which would tighten regulations, enhance inspections, and provide training and resources to day care providers and parents to ensure the safety of children in child day care homes, programs, and facilities across New York State.
Items.MatterName: Tighten regulations, enhance inspections, and provide training and resources to day care providers and parents to ensure the safety of children in child day care homes, programs, and facilities across New York State (S.6225/A.3899-A).
